questions.answer: In 1834, a customs union named 'Zollverein' was formed at the initiative of Prussia, which was joined by most German states. This union abolished tariff barriers and reduced the number of currencies from over thirty to two. It helped in the creation of a unified economic territory.

questions.text: Who were the Grimm Brothers? What was their contribution to the development of German national sentiments?
questions.originalText: Grimm bandhu kaun the? Unhone German rashtriya bhavnaon ke vikas me kya yogdan diya?
questions.answer: The Grimm Brothers (Jacob and Wilhelm) were German scholars who collected old folktales. They believed these tales expressed the pure spirit of the common people ('volk') and helped build German national identity by promoting the German language and culture against French domination.

questions.text: Write the main objectives of the Treaty of Vienna.
questions.originalText: Vienna sandhi ke pramukh uddeshya likhiye.
questions.answer: (1) To undo the changes brought about in Europe during the Napoleonic wars. (2) To prevent French expansion in the future. (3) To restore the monarchies that had been overthrown by Napoleon. (4) To create a new conservative order in Europe.
Conservatism is a political philosophy that emphasizes tradition, established institutions, and customs, and prefers gradual development to quick change.

questions.text: Briefly describe the unification of Italy.
questions.originalText: Italy ke ekikaran ka sanshipt varnan kijiye.
questions.answer: Giuseppe Mazzini formed secret societies like 'Young Italy'. Count Cavour led the diplomatic alliance with France to defeat Austrian forces in 1859. Giuseppe Garibaldi led armed volunteers to march into South Italy. In 1861, Victor Emmanuel II was proclaimed king of united Italy.
